com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Interface ValueMapRenderer

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, LegendInfo, Renderer
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseValueMapRenderer
public interface ValueMapRenderer
extends Renderer

A Valuemap renderer provides support for rendering based upon the value of an attribute - defined by one of the associated FeatureLayer's Fields. Symbology choices can be added via one of four methods, addUniqueValue and addRange will construct appropriate LegendClass objects for given Symbol and value or range of values. addLegendClass will add a LegendClass directly. setLegendCLass allows you to replace one of the existing LegendClass objects.

clearLegendClasses

Remove all LegendClasses.

fetchSymbol

public Symbol fetchSymbol(Object value)
Fetch a Symbol corresponding to the given attribute value. If the value is not represented by a LegendClass, then the DefaultSymbol will be returned. Note that the DefaultSymbol may be null.

Parameters:
value - the value

fetchLegendClass

public LegendClass fetchLegendClass(Object value)
Fetch a LegendClass corresponding to the given attribute value. If the value is null, or not represented by any LegendClass, then null will be returned.

Parameters:
value - the value

setCompareStringsTrim

public void setCompareStringsTrim(boolean b)
Sets this property to true if you want all String comparisons to ignore preceding and trailing spaces. Set to false if you want these spaces to be significant.

Parameters:
b - true == ignore spaces, false otherwise

getCompareStringsTrim

public boolean getCompareStringsTrim()
Gets the current state of String trimming for comparison.

See Also:
setCompareStringsTrim(boolean)

hasClassBreaks

public boolean hasClassBreaks()
Deteremine if this ValueMapRenderer has any LegendClasses that contain a Range. This kind of LegendClass is known as a "ClassBreak"

Returns:
true == there is at least one ClassBreak, false == there are no ClassBreaks
